intro: Cymopterus plurijugus, commonly known as the many-jointed evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Cymopterus plurijugus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
